It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically a mix of red and white, with intricate patterns resembling handwritten text. The plant has a delicate, herbaceous structure with narrow, linear leaves that grow along a slender stem. Its blooming period is brief, usually occurring in late spring or early summer. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Mechowia redactifolia is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
